question: [File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Pending blocks manipulation] At line 98, pending_uncommitted_blocks is used in threshold - can this be manipulated by Byzantine validators proposing many blocks to disable backpressure and flood the network? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Exclude authors bypass] At line 118, maybe_optqs_payload_pull_params contains exclude_authors HashSet - can this be empty or manipulated to not exclude Byzantine validators' batches? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Batch age bypass] In OptQSPayloadPullParams, minimum_batch_age_usecs constraint - can this be set to 0 allowing immediate batch inclusion without quorum certification delay? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [None params attack] When maybe_optqs_payload_pull_params is None at line 118, are OptQS constraints skipped? Can this allow inclusion of uncertified or malicious batches? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Author set manipulation] Can exclude_authors HashSet in OptQSPayloadPullParams be manipulated to exclude all validators, causing pull to always return empty payloads and halt consensus? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Metric manipulation] At line 101, WAIT_FOR_FULL_BLOCKS_TRIGGERED.observe() - can metric observation failures cause the function to panic or return early, bypassing payload pull? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Monitor macro] At line 76, monitor! macro wraps timeout - can this macro's implementation cause performance degradation or deadlocks affecting consensus timing? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Info log] At lines 130-138, info! logging occurs - can extremely large payloads cause log overflow, memory exhaustion, or performance degradation during logging? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Debug format exploit] At line 131, pull_params uses Debug format - can malicious params with crafted strings cause log injection or format string vulnerabilities? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Fail point injection] At lines 103-105, fail_point! macro can inject errors - can this be exploited in production if fail points aren't properly disabled, allowing DoS through error injection? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Fail point bypass] Can fail point at line 103 be triggered by external input (e.g., via configuration), allowing attackers to remotely cause consensus to fail payload pulls? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Quorum store compromise] If quorum store component is compromised, can it send malicious payloads through GetPayloadResponse that bypass consensus validation at line 84? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Consensus caller trust] Does pull() assume caller provides valid PayloadPullParameters? Can malicious consensus components call pull() with adversarial parameters to force invalid payloads? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Struct: QuorumStoreClient] [Channel sender compromise] If consensus_to_quorum_store_sender is cloned and shared across components, can malicious components intercept or modify GetPayloadCommand messages? (High)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Response hijacking] Between sending request at line 73 and receiving at line 78, can responses be hijacked or redirected by malicious middleware components? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Memory leak] In retry loop at lines 109-129, if pull_internal() continuously allocates memory for GetPayloadRequest objects that are never freed, can this cause memory leak? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Channel memory] At line 58, oneshot::channel allocates - if pull_internal is called in tight loop due to retry, can this exhaust memory with pending channels? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Clone overhead] At lines 118 and 120, clone() operations occur in retry loop - can large OptQSPayloadPullParams or PayloadFilter cause memory exhaustion through repeated clones? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Payload accumulation] Does returned Payload at line 128 get properly freed after use? Can large payloads accumulate if consensus doesn't process them quickly? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Unsafe operations] Are there any unsafe blocks in GetPayloadRequest/Response handling that could cause undefined behavior or memory corruption? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Struct: QuorumStoreClient] [Clone safety] QuorumStoreClient derives Clone at line 23 - can cloning consensus_to_quorum_store_sender cause reference counting issues or shared mutable state bugs? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Await cancellation] If pull() is cancelled mid-execution (e.g., tokio task cancelled), can this leave pull_internal in inconsistent state with pending requests? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Future cancellation] If timeout fires at line 78 while callback_rcv is being processed, can this cause use-after-drop or double-free in oneshot channel receiver? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Max iterations] Is there a maximum iteration count for retry loop at lines 109-129? Can malicious quorum store cause infinite retries exceeding max_poll_time due to timing races? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/payload_client/user/quorum_store_client.rs] [Function: pull()] [Sleep overflow] At line 125, sleep(Duration::from_millis(NO_TXN_DELAY)) where NO_TXN_DELAY=30 - can accumulated sleep time exceed max_poll_time but loop continues? (Low)
